welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

response.value:
Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the "hero" section WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value Detection Algorithm: Check if interactive elements have accessible names. Explanation of Error: The button does not have an accessible name. Assistive technologies use this to help users understand the purpose of the button. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the "video-section" section WCAG Guideline violated: 1.2.2 Captions (Prerecorded) Detection Algorithm: Check if video elements have captions. Explanation of Error: The video does not have captions. Captions are necessary for deaf or hard-of-hearing individuals to understand the video content. --- Snippet with error: `
` Location of error: Inside the "contact" section, in the form WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships Detection Algorithm: Check if form input elements have associated labels. Explanation of Error: The radio button does not have an associated label. Labels provide necessary context for the input field, improving accessibility. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the "contact" section, in the form WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions Detection Algorithm: Check if form input elements have associated labels. Explanation of Error: The password input field does not have an associated label. Labels provide necessary context for the input field, improving accessibility.

followups.message: What are some best practices for providing accessible names for interactive elements in HTML?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot
